basics.name: Zoher Kachwala
basics.label: PhD Candidate & Student Researcher in AI/ML
basics.summary: PhD candidate specializing in Large Language Models with focus on evaluation, interpretability, and production deployment. Research expertise spans rigorous model assessment, transparent AI systems, and real-world applications for semantic search and safe content generation. Experienced in research-to-production deployment, rigorous experimental design, and translating complex AI research into practical tools and frameworks.

publications.name: Advanced Heuristics for LLM Decoding Improve Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
publications.abstract: Develops novel decoding strategies that enhance chain-of-thought reasoning in LLM deployment, improving performance on complex reasoning tasks with measurable gains.

publications.name: Fine-Tuning Specialized LLMs for Large-Scale Community Content Moderation
publications.abstract: Fine-tuning and deploying specialized LLMs for production content moderation across 500+ online communities; developing interpretable moderation framework addressing real-world safety challenges.

publications.name: Task-Aligned Prompting Improves Detection of AI-Generated Images in VLMs
publications.abstract: Developed zero-shot prompting methodology (zero-shot-s$^2$) achieving 29% F1 improvement in VLM performance, providing interpretable alternatives to supervised approaches for multimodal AI systems.

publications.name: REMATCH: Robust and Efficient Knowledge Graph Matching
publications.abstract: Developed novel semantic similarity metric with 5x computational efficiency improvement and 5% accuracy gains, alongside comprehensive benchmark (RARE) advancing knowledge graph research infrastructure.

publications.name: A Multi-Platform Collection of Social Media Posts on the 2022 U.S. Midterm Elections
publications.abstract: Constructed and released 30M-post research dataset enabling research in information systems, narrative analysis, and misinformation detection across the research community.

publications.name: The Inexplicable Efficacy of Language Models
publications.abstract: Comprehensive survey of LLM capabilities across domains, analyzing production trade-offs and generalization principles for advancing foundational AI research.

projects.name: Large-Scale Content Moderation with Specialized LLMs
projects.summary: Fine-tuning and deploying specialized LLMs for production content moderation across 500+ online communities; developing interpretable moderation framework addressing real-world safety challenges.

projects.name: Text2Graph: Scalable Knowledge Extraction
projects.summary: Designed system for extracting structured knowledge representations from text at scale, enabling knowledge-grounded reasoning in large language models.

projects.name: Foundational Transformer Architecture Analysis
projects.summary: Conducted comprehensive literature review and analysis of foundational Transformer architectures, contributing to understanding of core mechanisms driving AI capabilities.

work.name: Introduction to Network Science
work.summary: Led collaborative Python-based tutorials on large-scale network analysis; guided students through graph neural network concepts and dynamic analytics for real-world applications.

work.name: Elements of Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Designed scalable autograding systems and provided collaborative support on foundational AI concepts including search, logic, and reasoning for 300+ students annually.

work.name: Applied Machine Learning
work.summary: Collaborated on PyTorch-based model development curriculum; emphasized reproducible research practices, scalable inference validation, and deployment-ready system design.

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers
work.summary: Collaborated on enterprise-scale data integration projects, focusing on automation of validation pipelines and scalable audit-ready logic modeling for large-scale systems.
